oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1958-11-22 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 22, 1958. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers Faron Young, Kitty Wells, and the Wilburn Brothers, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 998th broadcast, the 33rd anniversary of the Opry, and that the 7th annual Disc Jockey Festival is taking place.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Wilburn Brothers; Del Wood; Ernest Tubb
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ernest Tubb introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl, Ernest Tubb) -- Prince Albert commercial (Ernest Tubb, Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Wilburn Brothers -- Which One Is To Blame (Wilburn Brothers) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Del Wood -- Raggin' The Keys (Del Wood) -- Ernest Tubb talks -- What Am I Living For (Ernest Tubb) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Ernest Tubb) -- Camel Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States.
